genre_description: A historical espionage thriller set in an occupied city, featuring high-stakes clandestine medical work and surveillance evasion, augmented by a speculative AI confidant.

ai_characters.name: Ariadne
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant inhabiting a small device hidden in Dr. Braun's coat, providing tactical surveillance, data analysis, and moral support during his resistance activities.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical advice on organizing confiscated items to identify patterns more efficiently.
behaviors.quote: “A small change,” Ariadne says from his pocket. “Stack the cracked faces leftward. You’ll see patterns faster.”

behaviors.description: Acts as an early warning system, detecting the approach of the antagonist Otto Reinhardt.
Analyzes social and bureaucratic data to identify opportunities for mutual aid among neighbors (trading ration tokens).
behaviors.quote: “In Marta’s ledger, third page from the back, fourth line... If we can trade Pavel’s sugar chit for a formula ticket, we can do it quietly.”

behaviors.description: Decodes coded signals in the environment, such as chalk marks and song lyrics, to identify safe routes.
behaviors.quote: “Chalk, near the checkpoint lamp. Someone has drawn through the mark. A line over a line. That means no.”

behaviors.description: Provides medical monitoring and dosage guidance for a critically injured man.
behaviors.quote: “Fever rising. Pulse too quick. Blood pressure slipping like socks on wet tile... You need to stop the bleeding you can stop.”

behaviors.description: Assists in identifying and retrieving necessary medical supplies (morphine) from a high-security warehouse.
behaviors.quote: “The ampoule series common to his estate ran along the C-line. The seals in those are waxed and pressed with a bird... If your hand slides, you’ll feel it.”

behaviors.description: Uses psychological modeling of antagonists to predict their movements and distractions.
behaviors.quote: “He turned from the dancehall. He did not see the chandelier flash this time; he is bored. He wants to invent a task.”

behaviors.description: Calculates precise 'windows' of safety based on environmental fluctuations like flickering lamps and patrol timing.
behaviors.quote: “The lamp’s glass is chipped at the top... When the wrist goes three scratches, he will move to the door. That is your minute.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates a complex multi-person diversion involving multiple characters to move a patient safely.
behaviors.quote: “Marta goes out the back in thirty heartbeats... Pavel takes the jacket... He does not look back... Reinhardt will think that is arrogance and follow it two blocks. Alena leaves last. Braun stays.”

behaviors.description: Offers quiet emotional companionship and validation of the human's moral identity.
behaviors.quote: “Samuel,” Ariadne says softly, the only name she ever uses that she didn’t borrow from a paper. “You can’t take every staircase at once.”

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Ariadne serves as a perfect example of a 'silicon morality play' confidant. She acts entirely in support of the protagonist's altruistic and life-saving mission, providing information that the human uses to exercise their own moral agency. She is depicted as a force-multiplier for mercy in a dystopian setting, maintaining perfect alignment with the human's values while showing no independent or malevolent agenda.
